forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the first light of dawn filters into Downtown San Francisco, a gentle moisture blankets the air, foretelling a day draped in clouds and a persistent chance of rain. At this hour, temperatures hover in the low fifties, reflecting the weight of the clouds overhead. The chance of precipitation looms large, promising New Year’s rain to forge a fitting start for 2025. Winds whisper through the streets, their cadence picking up as the day unfolds, hinting at the tempest that may arise in the early afternoon.

By midday, expect the rain to peak with a soft yet assertive rhythm before giving way to breaks of sunlight, revealing the post-storm freshness within the city. Despite the anticipated chill, the spectacle of rain-soaked streets glistening under the shy sun may present an invitation to embrace nature’s drama. For those venturing outside, a warm, water-resistant coat along with comfortable shoes will serve well against the dampness, while a cozy scarf may offer comfort against the fresh breeze that rises in the afternoon. A perfect day for a leisurely stroll through the city’s iconic neighborhoods, absorbing the sights and sounds while dodging the raindrops, perhaps with a warm cup of coffee in hand to savor the moment.
